meanings.sent1: The teacher spoke dully, causing the students to yawn.
meanings.sent2: The movie played dully on the screen, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The party turned out dully, with no music or dancing to liven it up.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting appeared dully, as if drained of all vibrancy.
meanings.sent5: Her voice echoed dully in the empty room, emphasizing the lack of enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: In a dull manner; without brightness or sharpness
meanings.sent1: The knife cut dully through the overcooked steak.
meanings.sent2: The stars shone dully in the cloudy night sky.
meanings.sent3: The old sword hung dully on the wall, never used in battle.
meanings.sent4: His memory of the event faded dully, like an old photograph left in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The bell rang dully, its sound muffled by the thick fog.
